Module org.tquadrat.foundation.xml
Package org.tquadrat.foundation.xml.builder.spi

Class XMLElementBase

java.lang.Object
org.tquadrat.foundation.xml.builder.internal.XMLElementImpl
org.tquadrat.foundation.xml.builder.spi.XMLElementBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
Element, XMLElement
@ClassVersion(sourceVersion="$Id: XMLElementBase.java 1030 2022-04-06 13:42:02Z tquadrat $") @API(status=DEPRECATED, since="0.0.5") @Deprecated(since="0.1.0", forRemoval=true) public abstract non-sealed class XMLElementBase extends XMLElementImpl
Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
Use XMLElementAdapter instead.
The abstract base class for specialised implementations of XMLElement. Because it is derived from XMLElementImpl, it supports attributes, namespaces, children, text, CDATA and comments.
Author:
Thomas Thrien (thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org)
Version:
$Id: XMLElementBase.java 1030 2022-04-06 13:42:02Z tquadrat $
Since:
0.0.5

  • Constructor Details

    • XMLElementBase

      protected XMLElementBase(String elementName)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      Creates a new XMLElementBase instance.

      The given element name is validated using the method that is provided by XMLBuilderUtils.getElementNameValidator().

      The new element allows attributes and children, but will not validate them. It also allows text.
      Parameters:
      elementName - The element name.

    • XMLElementBase

      protected XMLElementBase(String elementName, Set<XMLElement.Flags> flags)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      Creates a new XMLElementImpl instance.

      The given element name is validated using the method that is provided by XMLBuilderUtils.getElementNameValidator().
      Note:
      • This constructor is used for the implementation of XML specialisations, like SVG or HTML (although this not really XML).
      Parameters:
      elementName - The element name.
      flags - The configuration flags for the new element.
      See Also:
      • XMLElement.Flags
      • AttributeSupport.registerAttributes(String...)
      • AttributeSupport.registerSequence(String...)
      • ChildSupport.registerChildren(String...)

    • XMLElementBase

      @Deprecated(forRemoval=true) protected XMLElementBase(String elementName, String[] validChildren, String[] validAttributes, String[] attributeSequence, boolean allowText)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      Use XMLElementBase(String, Set) instead.
      Creates a new XMLElementImpl instance.

      The given element name is validated using the method that is provided by XMLBuilderUtils.getElementNameValidator().
      Parameters:
      elementName - The element name.
      validChildren - The list of the names for valid children; if null, no children are allowed, if empty, children are allowed, but they will not be validated.
      validAttributes - The list of the valid attributes; if empty or null, the attributes will not be validated.
      attributeSequence - The sequence for the attributes; if empty or null, the attributes will be sorted alphabetically.
      allowText - true if the element allows text, false if not.
      See Also:
      • AttributeSupport.registerAttributes(String...)
      • AttributeSupport.registerSequence(String...)
      • ChildSupport.registerChildren(String...)
